alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Avalanche Watch issued December 11 at 5:05PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: THE FOLLOWING MESSAGE IS TRANSMITTED AT THE REQUEST OF THE COLORADO AVALANCHE INFORMATION CENTER. * WHAT...Avalanche Watch * WHERE... Southeast San Juan Mountains including Wolf Creek Pass, Cumbres Pass, La Manga Pass south to the New Mexico border. * WHEN... Very dangerous avalanche conditions begin on Monday evening December 12 and last through Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...You can expect to easily trigger large and dangerous avalanche on most slopes as new snow accumulates. * PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...Travel in backcountry avalanche terrain is not recommended from Monday night through Tuesday night.Stay up-to-date with changing conditions at colorado.gov/avalanche. Cooperstein

area.areaDesc: Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Ft
